name: cobrapy
description: COBRApy is a Python package that provides a simple interface to metabolic constraint-based reconstruction and analysis.

references.title: COBRApy: COnstraints-Based Reconstruction and Analysis for Python
references.authors: Ali Ebrahim, Joshua A Lerman, Bernhard O Palsson & Daniel R Hyduke

kisaoTerm.name: flux balance analysis
kisaoTerm.description: Flux balance analysis is a mathematical approach for analyzing the flow of metabolites through a metabolic network.

modelingFrameworks.name: flux balance framework
modelingFrameworks.description: Modelling approach, typically used for metabolic models, where the flow of metabolites (flux) through a network can be calculated. This approach will generally produce a set of solutions (solution space), which may be reduced using objective functions and constraints on individual fluxes.

references.title: What is flux balance analysis?
references.authors: Jeffrey D. Orth, Ines Thiele & Bernhard Ø. Palsson

kisaoTerm.name: flux variability analysis
kisaoTerm.description: FVA (or flux variability analysis) finds the ranges of each metabolic flux at the optimum.

modelingFrameworks.name: flux balance framework
modelingFrameworks.description: Modelling approach, typically used for metabolic models, where the flow of metabolites (flux) through a network can be calculated. This approach will generally produce a set of solutions (solution space), which may be reduced using objective functions and constraints on individual fluxes.

references.title: The effects of alternate optimal solutions in constraint-based genome-scale metabolic models

kisaoTerm.name: reactions
kisaoTerm.description: List of reactions to compute the variability of.

kisaoTerm.name: loopless
kisaoTerm.description: Whether to return only loopless solutions for FVA.

kisaoTerm.name: fraction of optimum
kisaoTerm.description: Requires that the objective value is at least the fraction times maximum objective value. A value of 0.85 for instance means that the objective has to be at least at 85% percent of its maximum.

kisaoTerm.name: pFBA Factor
kisaoTerm.description: Add an additional constraint to the model that requires the total sum of absolute fluxes must not be larger than this value times the smallest possible sum of absolute fluxes

kisaoTerm.name: parallelism
kisaoTerm.description: The parallelism to run. If not explicitly passed, will be set from the global configuration singleton.

algorithms.name: parsimonious enzyme usage flux balance analysis

kisaoTerm.name: parsimonious enzyme usage flux balance analysis
kisaoTerm.description: pFBA adds the minimization of all fluxes the the objective of the model. This approach is motivated by the idea that high fluxes have a higher enzyme turn-over and that since producing enzymes is costly, the cell will try to minimize overall flux while still maximizing the original objective function, e.g. the growth rate.

modelingFrameworks.name: flux balance framework
modelingFrameworks.description: Modelling approach, typically used for metabolic models, where the flow of metabolites (flux) through a network can be calculated. This approach will generally produce a set of solutions (solution space), which may be reduced using objective functions and constraints on individual fluxes.

references.title: Omic data from evolved E. coli are consistent with computed optimal growth from genome‐scale models
references.authors: Nathan E Lewis, Kim K Hixson, Tom M Conrad, Joshua A Lerman, Pep Charusanti, Ashoka D Polpitiya, Joshua N Adkins, Gunnar Schramm, Samuel O Purvine, Daniel Lopez‐Ferrer, Karl K Weitz, Roland Eils, Rainer König, Richard D Smith & Bernhard Ø Palsson

kisaoTerm.name: fraction of optimum
kisaoTerm.description: Requires that the objective value is at least the fraction times maximum objective value. A value of 0.85 for instance means that the objective has to be at least at 85% percent of its maximum.

kisaoTerm.name: geometric flux balance analysis
kisaoTerm.description: Geometric FBA formulates the problem as a polyhedron and then solves it by bounding the convex hull of the polyhedron. The bounding forms a box around the convex hull which reduces with every iteration and extracts a unique solution in this way.

modelingFrameworks.name: flux balance framework
modelingFrameworks.description: Modelling approach, typically used for metabolic models, where the flow of metabolites (flux) through a network can be calculated. This approach will generally produce a set of solutions (solution space), which may be reduced using objective functions and constraints on individual fluxes.

references.title: Flux balance analysis: A geometric perspective

kisaoTerm.name: relative tolerance
kisaoTerm.description: This parameter is a numeric value specifying the desired relative tolerance the user wants to achieve.

kisaoTerm.name: maximum iterations
kisaoTerm.description: For algorithms that iterate to a solution (steady state finders in particular), a limit on the number of iterations that should be performed.
